ETYMOLOGY: From Latin associatio, from associare 'to join to, unite with', from ad- 'to' + sociare 'to join', from socius 'companion'.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: an association for [sth] | an association of [sb]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An organized group of people with a common purpose or interest.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 有共同目的或兴趣的人们组成的组织或团体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The local residents' association meets monthly to discuss community issues.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当地居民协会每月开会讨论社区问题。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A connection or relationship between things or people.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 事物或人之间的联系或关系。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There's a strong association between smoking and lung cancer.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 吸烟和肺癌之间存在着密切的关联。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A mental connection between ideas or things, or the idea itself that is suggested by something else.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 思想或事物之间的一种心理联系；或由某事物联想到的想法。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: For many, the smell of fresh bread has an association with childhood.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 对许多人来说，新鲜面包的气味会让他们联想到童年。
